intro: Terrellia hirsutiglumis, commonly known as the hairy-leaf terrellia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a rough texture. Its small, pale yellow flowers bloom in summer and are followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. Terrellia hirsutiglumis is often found in moist, wooded areas and is considered a rare and endangered species.
